review_title: Exceptional patient focused and mission driven hospital
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fort Worth, TX
pros: - Patient focused atmosphere - comradery among employees - Advanced equipment and clean modern facility
cons: - Numbers are often heavily emphasized

review_title: CRONYISM IS RAMPANT - Strongly discourage from joining here - Please think twice
pros: Managers and below have been some of the best people I've worked with. That's it.
cons: There are a ton of red flags while working here that I noticed: #1 is CRONYISM - they will hire new grads for directorship and above positions with no experience. They get preferential treatment just because they are in a special program and are Adventist. I have seen deserving, more experienced people get passed up for promotions because of this practice. #2 Culture - this is something they brag about, but don't live day to day. The culture is great for frontline workers, but not directors and above. Some don't know how to lead, are not experienced in running this business, and have friends in high places to get to their positions. #3 Pay - pay is below market. In the past years, they've tried to keep up with rapid inflation, but it is not enough. #4 No room for advancement - people here either have worked for 30+ years to get promoted, or are replaced by young, inexperienced people. #5 Always short staffed - good if you like to get extra shifts, but bad if you're salaried and are expected to work 60 hour weeks. So short-staffed that no one else but you will pick up the slack. #6 Bad managers - they keep bad managers solely because they have been there forever, or are Adventists. These managers take credit for all your work and overwork you. Ask for help and they won't do anything because there's no budget for additional help. These managers aren't fired. In fact, they even try to promote them within the AdventHealth network of hospitals. Instead of releasing dead weight, they'd rather that person be someone else's problem. #7 Favoritism - rampant. If you're not in the in crowd, your life will be miserable. Very clicky.

pros: Very connected with teams. Loves their patients and team members. The CNO really cares and connects with the team. The exec team does so much for everyone
cons: Can’t think of a thing

pros: Faith based, genuinely caring leaders and front line team members
cons: Interstate 35 can be tough at times

job_title: Nurse Leader in Fort Worth, TX
pros: As we embarked on our great go-live epic journey, the staff pulled together with so much excitement these last few months. The engagement was outstanding. As we move finish go live day 1, I witness so many THH employees so love and inclusivity to the contingent epic experts and pay it forward experts from other AdventHealth facility. The THH staff embraced the newcomers, loved them, and cared for them like they would, one they love the most.
cons: Nothing! The team is why I stay. The people are amazing. Our executive team is amazing. Putting love at the forefront of everything we do, every day, and getting follow our calling from God in ways that brings joy daily!

job_title: RN Circulator, OR in Burleson, TX
pros: Pay. Good management. Some of the surgeons are amazing.
cons: Some of the surgeons are difficult to work with. On call. Weekend call is especially bad. Always out of supplies or on back order

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Learn to be adaptive because of learning opportunities, either sink or swim.
cons: Pregnancy discrimination, nepotism, backstabbing, and favoritism, The harder you work the more they will abuse you.

pros: The best this is the health insurance.
cons: Totally a difficult position to be in, when a job description states you have a minimum amount of times be able to obtain or collect a blood specimen from a patient. As a caring employee, you have no control of the condition your patients veins are in when they come into the hospital. I've never seen this before, not even in a Nurse or in a Anesthesiologist job description has this type of pressure. The pay isn't even close for the pressure or the mental health risk you will put yourself through for a job like this.

review_title: Poor employee benefits and toxic environment
pros: The job does offer to reimburse for school given that you work for the hospital after degree is obtained. Pay is bi-weekly. Retirement, 401k, and insurance available for full-time employees. PTO starts accruing on day one. Discounted gym membership rate for employees. Discounted food items from hospital cafeteria for employees.
cons: No benefits available for contracted rns. No paid maternity leave for anyone, not even full-time employees. Insurance options have high co-pays, poor coverage. Any time-off like sick time or to attend personal dr appointments take off of your PTO automatically. I overhear many employees speak badly of patients and their ailments behind their backs. Toxic people work there which makes the whole environment miserable. Janitorial cleaning/disinfecting is extremely poor (if done at all in done areas) which is really bad for a hospital that houses sick people. HR will not resolve any issues brought to them. You will be gaslighted.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Burleson, TX
pros: Wonderful mission statement. Great initiatives coming from Corporate.
cons: Nepotism and Cronyism is rampant. Each employee outside of the "group" is treated poorly. If you mention any wrong doing they will automatically make you a target. Fairy tales and exaggerations will be used against you if they can't get you on performance. If you are related or chosen by their leadership you can feel free to make as many errors as needed in order to learn. People on the bottom end up carrying those on top. They have their own sort of caste system. Absolutely toxic work environment.

pros: They are team oriented. They are always working to be better.
cons: Nothing really. They are a great place.
